result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Jordan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.

NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.

Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention.
Parenting classes.

AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.

timeConds.notes: STAYED pending a review on 1-8-2016 at 1:15 pm in Branch 38.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Jordan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brandon Jordan in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Brandon Jordan in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  AS to the charged offense:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction,  with credit for 3 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 20 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 1-8-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention..
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Brandon Jordan in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.

JusticePoint Violation Report received and filed.
Defendant appears with Matthew McCallen from JP.  Atty Dluzak is in other courts.  ADA Sarra Kiaie appears for the state.  Court admonished defendant to comply with conditions of release.  Pretrial date is changed to 9-2-2015 at 8:15.
Atty Dluzak was advised of date change.

Defendant Brandon Jordan in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
New defense counsel will need to obtain discovery from pror counsel.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 38 on 9-3-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Kejuana J., no firearms, absolute sobriety, cooperate with Justice Point Supervision and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KEJUANA J.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brandon Jordan in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Brandon Jordan in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
